intro: Behen vesicarium, commonly known as the bladder nut, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, inflated, seed-containing pods that resemble small bladders. These pods, which are the primary feature of the plant, are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. The botanical features of Behen vesicarium make it unique in both its appearance and its utility in various cultural practices.
